intro: Crepis bungeana, commonly known as the Bunge's mouse-ear, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in clusters, often blooming in late summer to early autumn. Crepis bungeana is often found in rocky soils and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
